Regulations 2020.

“IBT certificate” has the same meaning that it has in the Regulations of

title: conferred on him by section 18 of the Road Traffic Act 1968 (No. 25 of 1968)
conferred on him by section 18 of the Road Traffic Act 1968 (No. 25 of 1968)
heading: 3. Notwithstanding Regulation 9 of, and Schedule 2 (inserted by
text_raw:
3. Notwithstanding Regulation 9 of, and Schedule 2 (inserted by 
Regulation 2(i) of the Road Traffic (Courses of Instruction) (Motorcycles) 
(Amendment) Regulations 2018 (S.I. No. 433 of 2018)) to, the Regulations of 
2011, an IBT certificate issued during the period beginning on 1 March 2018 
and ending on 30 June 2018 is valid for a period of 2 years and 4 months from 
the date of issue. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Transport, 
Tourism and Sport, 
9 April, 2020. 

SHANE ROSS, 

Minister for Transport, Tourism 
and Sport. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 14th April, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [123] 3

title: conferred on him by section 18 of the Road Traffic Act 1968 (No. 25 of 1968)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend 
the Road Traffic (Courses of Instruction) 
(Motorcycles) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 681 of 2011) to provide that a 
certificate of satisfactory completion of initial basic training for motorcyclists, 
an IBT certificate, issued during the period beginning on 1 March 2018 and 
ending on 30 June 2018 is valid for a period of 2 years and 4 months from the 
date of issue. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [123]
